On december 16, 2013
wapu3

take this as an example plain and simple

An opponent gives you 2-hit combo that deals 100 damage per hit.

Ballet shoes can 100% save you from the first 100 damage instead of taking 200 pure combo damage.

It also applies even in level 99.It can save you from higher damage from the first attack.

Lead Skeleton is helpful too. Who said it's not noticeable? lol, it actually is. e.g
A flail that deals 80-90 damage can be reduce up to 60-70. You're are guaranteed 30% reduced damage regardless of your opponents STR. . But ofcourse Resistant is better than LSkeleton. For a low HP brute like me, It helps me a lot against brute with tremendous amount of str+Hammer skill.

On january 9, 2014
MrPapaya
DaimoreShould I go for Knife? Other option is +3 speed. I have high hopes of getting shield on this brute, but I don't see it happening.
I'm Daimore:
http://mybrute.muxxu.com/fight/115685...

Knife will handicap you, because you have low strength and no Weapons Master. You will do so little damage it will be counter-productive. Level 17 is early to give up on getting Shield, you should patiently climb to level 25-30, no less, before calling quits on this path. The most necessary skills for Whip-masters are 6th Sense & Fists of Fur, while Shield and Martial Arts are the backup mode. Whip is also a somewhat slow weapon, so +speed is relevant.

From Fist of Steel onwards, there will be 64 brutes per tournament. (copy pasted this from the FAQ Threads and Resources sticky).

I won 3 BL tournaments with my two brutes before going for levels with them.
My brute that is like yours won at levels 16 and 21, but did get a lot of good skills early.
My flail brute, which was a reasonable brute for tournaments, won at level 26.

I've found the level 35+ BL brutes more challenging. There seem to be fewer bad brutes to challenge from this point.

187MOBSTAZoh oo harder enemy thats was unfair wish could only 25 levels if you challenges ur opponent for example my brute is level 16 good skill and good weapon VS 25 have bad path do you think level 16 wins the tournament if he challenges level 25 at the end of fight

Luck is a big factor. A very good level 16 brute has a better chance of victory than a bad level 25 brute. I even beat bad level 30 brutes at level 16. However, I also lost against bad level 16 brutes. It is annoying when the brute you beat all the time in training ends your run in the tournament. I think fewer people stick with bad brutes as the levels get higher in BL. Instead they try to win a tournament and try out another path or destiny.

shuriken scales very hard with str

so shuriken is good at early lvls, but not at late ones

On april 24, 2014
[1848820]

First strike.


It is the best single skill in the game, even better than its name implies. You get the first attacks plural with most weapons, if your opponent does not also have first strike. This allows you to do such things as beating your opponent before they even move, disarming their shield, sabotaging their weapons.


With feline agility you can hit more often, so these skills go well together.

On april 25, 2014
[1848820]
goatwhat if opponent has ballet shoes

At higher levels, ballet shoes becomes less noticeable.
More brutes have determination which has a 70% chance of making ballet shoes useless.
Brutes have higher agility so often multi hit - ballet shoes only avoids one hit which could have anyway missed or been blocked without the skill.


Ballet shoes can still help in certain circumstances, like against a brute with first strike, fierce brute and axe. However, many people consider ballet shoes as one of the less valuable skills and some people even decline it in hope of having a better chance for another skill.
On april 25, 2014

pelell1

That is a tough call. On one hand you could use the endurance as your HP is only 243; however, your high agi + untouchable keeps you safe long enough to win fights. On the other hand chef takes 2% of the opponents hit points which at higher levels means more damage - downside being it happens at the end of the opponents turn and with your high agi you have a high initiative and it costs one death.

All that being said I would take +3 end, even with the boring drudgery of just getting yet another +3 something.

If you take chef I would totally understand since it would mean getting to use something new and the green flash is kind of pretty

[5252706]
hollyalbion

Which is Better

HS+LB+VIT -vs- HS+FA+Vit ?

I already got Vit, after few levels got offered LB and I took it..did i make the right choice for taking LB? Note: assuming i will get HS as third booster
any thoughts?

LB has downside, FA doesn't (not sure if there's any). Having LB, you will most likely get 6th sensed or counter attacked. Besides, there's reconnaissance to boost your speed (if you wish to have all your stats covered.)


FA improves accuracy, multi-hit and dodge rate. LB only speed (which is unnoticeable in most cases especially when your opponent has average speed).

Scuffold

LB has downside, FA doesn't (not sure if there's any). Having LB, you will most likely get 6th sensed or counter attacked. Besides, there's reconnaissance to boost your speed (if you wish to have all your stats covered.)


FA improves accuracy, multi-hit and dodge rate. LB only speed (which is unnoticeable in most cases especially when your opponent has average speed).

Multi hit (added by FA) increases the chances of getting a hit blocked and then counter attacked :p

On august 13, 2014
pelell1

Thief works out well if you have skills that will help when you pick up weapons. in other words with thief you would also want weapons master, determination, relentless, bodybuilder etc. Unlike a "normal" weapon build where you would not take say bodybuilder if you were building a knife/board sword brute with thief you try to be prepared for whatever weapon you may steal.

Thief can be awesome but being a jack-of-all is a pain when thief does not go off.

Pray like most for MA,
Good Luck

basshwhat is tamer ?

you know those annoying pets that just wont shut up? for example on planes, trains you name it!

tl;dr eat pets to recover health

Chef is bad when it falls into the wrong brute's hand. Saboteur is also helpful. These are suitable only for those who can survive all fights without consuming all deaths.

Here are few explanation why it is essential.

- It gives more damage to opponents with high HP/immortal brutes for quicker annihilation. If you don't have MA to penetrate one's armor, chef will do the job. In this example, i don't have MA so chef contributes further damage to opponents.

On september 13, 2014
[1214962]
gotzewhats wrong with sword

Sword is blocked too often - I have a fight where a dog blocked it 6 times in a row.
It is a very slow weapon, an opponent wth resistant has all the time in the world to beat you.
It is also not that accurate, good agility is required.

It has its pluses as well - great damage with weapons master, can multi hit, and good blocking too. In my case I don't regret taking it. However, Ninja Angel has low agility and doesn't have the supporting skills for sword.
On september 13, 2014
egin
gotzewhats wrong with sword

well pretty much just that its blocked really easily.
it has huge damage with WM, it has good 6th sense, good multi hit and good blocking.
having it with determination and WM worked out pretty well for me even though at higher levels it sometimes caused trouble because almost all the opponents had shield + CA.

On november 3, 2014
Aardvark

Aye, but the choice is not LB or Vit. It's LB or possibly if he's lucky getting offered Vit later. I would take LB if it was the 3rd stat booster anyway, but especially if the brute already has recon.
Resistant may not help as much when opponents are multi-hitting, but it still helps. By the time brutes are doing 6-7 hits per attack you need to have built up a lot of health to survive anyway. My level 105 brute has 825 health (which isn't loads I know, but still not low), but most brutes of a similar level have very high strength and frequently trigger the resistant skill, so I'd get wiped out a lot quicker if I didn't have it.
Of course, skills to avoid getting hit so much are also key; pets, untouchable, hostility, counter-attack, shield, iron head.

On november 8, 2014
[7961880]

Which of these 2 are considered most important in high levels e.g lvl60+
Tamer or Tragic Potion? Is the amount of hp regained from these based on damage taken or some percentage of your total HP?
On november 8, 2014
Abel
RegretzWhich of these 2 are considered most important in high levels e.g lvl60+
Tamer or Tragic Potion? Is the amount of hp regained from these based on damage taken or some percentage of your total HP?

Okay, Tamer is way better and your next questions are what determine it.

The amount of HP regained from Tragic Potion is 25-50% of damage taken, so if you have 250 HP, take 50 damage and use Tragic Potion, you'd only be recovering about 13-25 HP.

Tamer recovers damage based on a percentage of your total health, so it can recover you to full health. Dogs recover 20% of total health, Panthers recover 30% and Bears recover 50%. So for example, if you have 300 HP and take 150 damage, eating a Dog would recover 60 HP, a Panther would recover 90 HP and a Bear would recover you to full Health.

Obviously the limit is your HP, so if you have 300 HP, take 20 Damage and eat a Dog, Panther or Bear, all of them would take you to full health.

I have Vitality so I'm inclined for Endurance.

On january 13, 2015
Aardvark

Largely agree, but it can't be seen as "backup" for shuriken. Rather, IMO, the sai then becomes the main weapon.
As soon as you take any other weapon alongside shuriken, the brute will normally throw away the shuriken after a few throws, in order to take the other weapon out. Only when he pulls out the shuriken second, will he continuing throwing it as he did before. So if anything taking the sai will CAUSE the brute to lose shuriken, not act as back up in case he loses it.
But as I said, I don't rate ninjas so much in higher levels and IMO taking sai is the best choice here.

On january 30, 2015
Aardvark

In my experience it's incredibly rare for a skill to be offered a second time. Off the top of my head, I think I've only been offered toughened skin more than once in the same destiny. I'm sure others do get offered sometimes, but I really think it's rare.

For me, if you're levelling up you should take most skills when offered over stats.
Personally, I would only definitely avoid flash flood (just shit), recon (just shit), ballet shoes (largely worthless later when most have determination) and net (on later levels you sometimes only hit once after throwing, which renders it counter-productive, and also negates first strike when facing a brute without pets).

Debatable ones would be toughened skin and armour (which I would avoid after the first few levels, toughened skin as doesn't do enough and armour as lowers speed), weapons master and bodybuilder (which I would avoid if I'd decided on weapons builds which didn't use the affected weapons), cry of the damned (which I would avoid if I had tamer or hypnosis), thief (which I would avoid if I didn't have the skills / stats to wield heavy weapons) and immortality (which I would avoid if offered later when I already had great stats and / or no vitality).

If you're ranking or ear-cutting it's a bit different and depends more on the build eg: I would refuse tragic potion and take the stat if ear-cutting with a low health resistant brute.

On february 8, 2015
[1848820]
Too_TonHow do you counter theie? I have good weapons vs brutes with none then they steal my weapon. Is having my own thief the only way to win in this case?

Some other ways
1. Fight well without a weapon, e.g. martial arts
2. Have a way to get rid of their (well really your) weapon, e.g. iron head, shock
3. Counter their attacks, e.g. shield, counter attack, hostility
4. Avoid their attacks, e.g. feline agility, untouchable
5. Have other good weapons available to draw
6. Let them steal a non OP weapon that works well for your build but not for other builds
7. (the ultimate) choose bumps as your only weapon

On march 19, 2015
[8465057]
Alzakielhttp://mybrute.muxxu.com/fight/133237...

Hi everyone ... Just started back playing after many years and i started myself a new brute ... Aint sure where im going, but with how i started my brute do you guys have any tips about what i might need to pick up in the next few level up ? *well if they give me the choice lol* my brute is Ezekielzz

get 6th sense to amplify the lance's 6th sense (attacking before your opponent does) potential, CA for the possible blocks, Shock, and for better sustain: Toughened skin, armor, lead skeleton, and immortality is good but will reduce your other status. Speed is a choice, because in my opinion it maximizes your preemptive attacks(attacking before they do in their turn) it also helps to get easier blocks/parries but this statement is only based from what i have experienced not too sure though. Strength is good for better damage and block rate. Get sabotage for weapon advantage and First strike to optimize sabotage's effectiveness; In the end it will all depend on you. btw whip has better 6th sense and shock potential I guess but it has higher risk of being blocked. Relentless for better hit rate to get those dodgers, I also think Fierce brute is also a factor in attacking without being blocked and improves your disarm rate.

Aardvark

Flash flood is a terrible skill.
The weapons thrown don't do nearly enough damage to make it worthwhile, and you will have lower stats due to having to take more weapons.
Only half the weapons you have at the time your brute uses the skill are thrown. As soon as you meet a brute with sabotage or your brute simply uses the skill late in the fight, you wind up taking one turn to throw 1 or 2 weapons.
I have it on a brute at level 118 and it's a total liability. And I have weapons like axe, flail, bumps, halberd ie: some very high damage ones.

On december 14, 2015
[9145718]

If you have many brutes, Spy is a big help because it applies for all of them (letting you see what the brutes you are about to fight have). However, it does cost one death for the brute that uses it... you may find stats is the better deal if your brute has Lightning Bolt or a low stat line.

I'd pick Spy, but I have 3 brutes!
